Based on your preferences, I would recommend "Divergent" as a great option for you.

"Divergent" is a science fiction film directed by Naohisa Kijima and produced by the Japanese film studio Tsubo. The film stars Lily Collins as Tris Prior,俊男杨洋饰Ari Pullman,艾米丽斯·范海伦饰Isabelle Beltrame,以及日本演员渡边谦饰演的Dr. May Jenkins.

Set in a futuristic society divided into five factions based on virtues: Amity (friendship), Discord (dissension), Efficiency (productivity), and Harmony (peace). The main character Tris Prior is forced to leave her faction, the Amity, at the age of 16 because she has been discovered to be Divergent, meaning she possesses qualities that are not found in the other factions.

Based on the user's preference cues and genre suggestions, here are two movie recommendations that may align with the user's interests:

1. "Inception" (2010)
   Plot Summary: The world is a dream within a dream. When a successful architect, Dom Cobb, is hired by an eccentric businessman, Arthur Dent, to go into his dreams and alter reality himself, Cobb embarks on a dangerous journey through parallel universes - where the past and future of each universe diverge from that of Earth. Cobb faces numerous challenges, including dealing with hostile dreamers and navigating treacherous dream landscapes. Throughout their journey, Cobb and Dent develop deep emotional connections with one another. Ultimately, Cobb is able to successfully alter reality itself as per his employer's instructions. However, Cobb realizes too late that altering reality itself may have unintended consequences of its own - particularly when it comes to matters involving human lives.
2. "The Devil Inside" (2012)
   Plot Summary: This psychological thriller explores the dark side of humanity through the story of Lisa, a young woman who, after escaping from a cult-like group known as "The Order," is diagnosed with severe mental illness and is placed on watch for her own safety and that of others. However, despite being under constant surveillance by law enforcement officials, Lisa begins to experience strange and disturbing visions - visions that appear to be directly connected to Lisa's own personal demons and traumas - traumas that Lisa has been unable to confront or deal with on an individual level - due to the fact that Lisa has been diagnosed with severe mental illness as per the diagnosis provided by her treating psychiatrist. As a result, Lisa has been unable to confront or deal with on an individual level the issues surrounding her own personal demons and traumas. As a result, Lisa has been placed on watch for her own safety and that of others - due to the fact that Lisa has been diagnosed with severe mental illness as per the diagnosis provided by her treating psychiatrist.

Based on these recommendations, you could consider watching either "The Imitation Game" or "Gone with the Wind" to see which one resonates more with your preferences.

Based on your preferences, I would recommend the movie "Paycheck" (2004) as it fits your genre preference of war and year preference of 1972.

The movie "Paycheck" tells the story of a middle-aged man who works as a bank teller. He is a hardworking man who tries his best to provide for his family. However, everything changes when he discovers that his employer has been using his hard work to line their pockets instead of paying him fairly for his work.

This movie is based on the true story of a man named Edward "Nick" Kelly who worked as a bank teller at Bank United in Manchester, England between 1970 and 1983.

I would recommend "Inglourious Basterds" as it has a similar theme of resistance against oppression.
The movie follows the story of Captain Jean-Paul "Jean-Paul" Curran, played by Brad Pitt, who leads a group of French soldiers known as the "Escadrille de la Raison", or simply the "Escadrille"), which is fighting against the German army during World War II. The main goal of the group is to stop flying missions and instead find ways to end the war and bring peace to France.
The movie also has a lot of great performances from the cast, including Brad Pitt, who plays Captain Jean-Paul "Jean-Paul" Curran, and Mélanie Laurent, who plays Camille "Cassie" de Varenne.
Overall, "Inglourious Basterds" is an excellent film that tells a compelling story about resistance against oppression.
